body.p: Sir: I am to inform you that Colonel Nicholson, of whose Character and Conduct you have received an unfavorable Impression, is in Town; he comes for the purpose of raising Recruits for a New York Battalion, to the Command of which he has been nominated. When I intimated to him, that from certain representations I had received, I judged him very unfit for the Employment, he insisted upon a Court of Enquiry to manifest his Innocence, and clear his reputation. Now Sir, as I am not well apprized of any particular charge to be exhibited against him, I must request you to acquaint me with what you know of the matter, and what persons it will be proper to call in as Witnesses; he may otherwise be acquited by the Court (when there are just Grounds of Accusation) merely for want of Testimony. I am, etc.
